Job Title: Production Manager

Location: Hilo, HI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Position: Production Manager

Location: Hilo, Hawaii

Pay: Up to $46,000/yr (depending on experience)

Experience: Supervisory level experience in operational management preferred

Education: High school diploma or GED; 2-year degree preferred

Type: Full-time; Direct Hire

Schedule: Day Shift

Staffing Solutions of Hawaii is seeking a Production Manager to join a growing and dynamic team!

Job Description:

Assigns trucks for business use and creates truck routes for drivers; coordinate movement of retail equipment (cages, totes, black bins) Direct involvement in handling logistics of trash removal/consolidation and recyclingResponsible for meeting all planned goals for transportation payroll budgetsInspection of machines and equipment to ensure specific operational performance and optimum utilization to include scheduled routine maintenance on equipment Analyzes total operations and make recommendations for operational changes where necessary Facilitates and ensures all state required certificates of title are current and arranges for updated registrations and state inspectionsResponsible for scheduling the staff efficiently and ensuring payroll is on track and in line with salesProvides guidance and direction to the production lead; communicate regularly with the team and keep them informed of pertinent informationRequisitions tools, equipment and supplies required for production activitiesCommunicate and enforce safety standards imposed by OSHA and State regulatory agencies to ensure a safe working environmentMaintains and tracks daily production goals, monitoring workers to ensure compliance with productions standards Attends and actively participates in sales management meetings and other organizational meetings as required; holds staff meetings to review sales management materials and discuss current store operations

Staffing Solutions of Hawaii is part of Array Corporation, the leading technology-enabled workforce solutions company whose mission is to fix how labor is bought, sold and delivered to enable universal access to the American Dream.

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
